page.title: 01SUMMARY OF HUTHWAITE
page.content:
Huthwaite is an ancient settlement on the Nottinghamshire-Derbyshire border. It is situated 2 miles west of Sutton-in-Ashfield and 5 miles west of Mansfield. Herod's Hill,arguably the highest point in Nottinghamshire, is to be found here.
Blackwell is the other settlement in the block. Situated over the county boundary, in Derbyshire, it occupies an extensive area.
The major industry until recently was that of coal mining. Now these mines have been exhausted. Clothing factories are predominant now along with an inland customs depot.
The M1 motorway runs through the area.
